item.title: Australian media misbehaves with Team India, spreads absurd lies about Ravindra Jadeja: Here's what actually happened - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Australian Media Misbehaves with Team India, Spreads Absurd Lies About Ravindra Jadeja

Date: Dec 21, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Australian media has made false claims against Indian all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja during the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy, accusing him of refusing to answer questions in English at a press conference.

  • The Australian media claims Jadeja refused to answer in English, but he was only responding to questions in Hindi posed by Indian reporters.
  • It was falsely reported that Jadeja said he had to leave for the bus, which he did not.
  • The conference was primarily for the travelling Indian media, although some Australian media was invited.
  • Journalists exhibited rude behavior towards the Indian media team.
“At no stage did Jadeja refuse to answer in English.”

The report reflects ongoing tensions between the Indian team and the Australian media amidst the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

item.title: Rohit Sharma nets session: No nonsense from fans to lengthy discussions over dismissals - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma nets session: No nonsense from fans to lengthy discussions over dismissals

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: Times of India

The Indian cricket team trained at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, attracting the attention of fans who gathered to see their favorite players, especially Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. The session was serious, focusing on Rohit's preparation for the upcoming Boxing Day Test.

  • Rohit was criticized for his recent poor performance, which included several low scores this tour.
  • He practiced with spin bowlers and engaged with younger players, providing guidance and encouragement.
  • An animated discussion with assistant coach Abhishek Nayar focused on Rohit's batting techniques and recent dismissals.
  • Rohit aims to improve his form in the next two Tests, especially in front of a large crowd for the Boxing Day match.
“Shuru main thoda aaram se daalo.” - Rohit Sharma advising on gentle throwdowns.

Rohit Sharma is determined to turn his form around in the upcoming Tests, knowing the significance of performing well in front of passionate fans.

item.title: 'They are not interested in helping Prithvi Shaw out': Former India cricketer criticises MCA's comments - The Times of India
item.description:
They are not interested in helping Prithvi Shaw out: Former India cricketer criticises MCA's comments

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The article discusses the criticism directed at the Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) for their perceived indifference towards the struggles of cricketer Prithvi Shaw. Former players have voiced their concerns, highlighting the need for support instead of neglect.

  • Prithvi Shaw faces challenges in his cricket career.
  • Former players express disappointment with MCA's attitude.
  • Calls for better support systems for struggling athletes.
“They are not interested in helping Prithvi Shaw out,” stated a former cricketer.

In conclusion, the article stresses the importance of supporting athletes in distress and criticizes the MCA for failing to step up for Shaw during his challenging times.

item.title: Bigg Boss 8 Telugu’s controversial beauty ties the knot with boyfriend - 123telugu
item.description:
Bigg Boss 8 Telugu’s Controversial Beauty Ties the Knot with Boyfriend

Published on Dec 21, 2024, Source: 123telugu.com

Though Bigg Boss 8 Telugu has concluded, news about the show and its contestants continues to make headlines.

  • Soniya Akula, a controversial contestant, was eliminated in the third week.
  • She tied the knot with her long-time boyfriend, Yashpa, in a ceremony attended by the Bigg Boss 8 Telugu team.
  • Soniya is known for her controversies and has appeared in a few films.
  • After her marriage, she aims to move on from her past and embrace a new chapter of her life.
Soniya has finally settled down.

This wedding marks a significant moment for Soniya Akula, highlighting the ever-evolving narratives of reality TV stars.

item.title: "When Top Order Doesn't Score...": Ravindra Jadeja's Stern Reminder To Virat Kohli And Co. With BGT .. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
When Top Order Doesn't Score...: Ravindra Jadeja's Stern Reminder To Virat Kohli And Co. With BGT On Line

Publication Date: December 2021, Source: NDTV Sports

India's all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has emphasized the importance of runs from the top order as the Indian team prepares for the crucial Boxing Day Test against Australia. His recent performance and insights shed light on the team’s batting struggles.

  • Jadeja called for better performance from the top order, which has struggled in previous tests.
  • He highlighted that pressure increases on the lower order when the top order fails to score.
  • In the rain-affected Brisbane Test, Jadeja scored 77 runs to help India secure a draw.
  • Despite a strong performance from opener KL Rahul, the rest of the batting lineup faltered.
  • Jadeja believes acclimatization to local conditions benefited his performance.
  • The series is currently tied 1-1, with the upcoming matches being crucial for retaining the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
"If everyone contributes in the batting unit, the team will do well." - Ravindra Jadeja

The Boxing Day Test poses a significant opportunity for India to secure a win and retain the trophy. Jadeja's reminder highlights the need for collective effort from the batting unit to succeed.

item.title: 'Notorious' stand, beer towers, and Boxing Day madness: MCG braces for Australia vs India - The Times of India
item.description:
Notorious stand, beer towers, and Boxing Day madness: MCG braces for Australia vs India

Publication Date: December 26, 2023 | Source: Times of India

On December 26, the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) is set to host a sold-out crowd of nearly 100,000 for the highly-anticipated Boxing Day Test between Australia and India. Security measures have been ramped up in response to the expected rowdy atmosphere, particularly from a notorious group known for their loud behavior.

  • Over 100,000 spectators expected for the match, with additional security personnel deployed.
  • Security staff count increased from 10 to up to 20 per block to manage the crowd.
  • Tickets for resale are fetching steep premiums, with prices rising from 30 AUD to upwards of 150 AUD.
  • Local marketplaces buzzing with fans reselling tickets, creating a festive and chaotic environment.
"They just come and drink. That loud bunch in those blue blocks. Beer just flows and expect the beer glass towers to get taller as the game progresses." - Security guard at MCG

The excitement leading up to the match showcases the vibrant cricket culture in Australia, with festivities continuing through the New Year.

item.title: After Getting Sacked, Prithvi Shaw Will Now Lead This Mumbai Cricket Association Team. But It's A De.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
After Getting Sacked, Prithvi Shaw Will Now Lead This Mumbai Cricket Association Team. But It's A Demotion

Publication Date: August 26, 2023 | Source: NDTV

Prithvi Shaw, who faced disciplinary issues leading to his exclusion from Mumbai's Vijay Hazare Trophy squad, has been given another chance as captain of the MCA Colts in the Police Invitation Shield Cricket Tournament 2024-25.

  • Shaw's past good statistics in List A cricket did not save him from being dropped due to indiscipline.
  • Despite his drop, the MCA shows willingness to support Shaw, highlighting a potential path to redemption.
  • Concerns regarding Shaw's fitness and training attendance have been raised by anonymous MCA sources.
  • Should he perform poorly, this tournament could mark his last opportunity to represent Mumbai.
“The fitness concern is there, but the performance is also not there currently. He needs to work on his fitness, discipline, and performance.” - Anonymous source within MCA

This opportunity in the Police Invitation Shield could be pivotal for Shaw, as his future in Mumbai cricket hangs in the balance.

item.title: Man Utd set one condition for Marcus Rashford transfer as Prem quartet are given firm answer - TEAMtalk
item.description:
Marcus Rashford Transfer Situation: Man Utd Sets Conditions

Publication Date: Not provided | Source: TeamTalk

Manchester United is keen to part ways with Marcus Rashford during the January transfer window, reportedly willing to loan him out but blocking any moves to Premier League rivals.

  • Rashford has been omitted from recent matchday squads, leading to speculation about his future.
  • Manchester United will not allow a loan move to Premier League clubs such as Arsenal, Man City, Tottenham, or Newcastle.
  • Possible loan destinations include clubs in Germany, France, and Spain, with Atletico Madrid showing interest.
  • Manager Ruben Amorim hopes Rashford can stay with the Red Devils, emphasizing his value to the team.
  • Rashford aims to test himself in La Liga but faces challenges from Barcelona's financial situation.
“Tomorrow [Friday] we have training, he will be there preparing for next game. He is a United player, everyone has a future at Man Utd.” - Amorim

Rashford's ongoing struggles have raised questions about his long-term future at Old Trafford.

item.title: 'D Gukesh will never be a player like Magnus Carlsen': Indian GM's coach Grzegorz Gajewski explains why - Firstpost
item.description:
D Gukesh's Unique Style: A Coach's Perspective on Comparisons with Magnus Carlsen

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Firstpost

Grzegorz Gajewski, the coach of Indian chess prodigy D Gukesh, asserts that while Gukesh is being compared to Magnus Carlsen, their playing styles are fundamentally different. He emphasized that Gukesh has a unique method of deep calculation rather than relying on intuition.

  • D Gukesh has become the youngest world chess champion after defeating Ding Liren.
  • Coach Grzegorz Gajewski believes Gukesh will never play like Carlsen but can mimic his style.
  • Gukesh prefers deep calculations over intuitive moves, which sets him apart from Carlsen.
  • Gukesh aims to reach the level of greatness achieved by Carlsen in his career.
  • He will compete next in the Tata Steel Chess Tournament 2025.
“He will never be a player like Magnus Carlsen in the sense of being an intuitive kind of a player.” - Grzegorz Gajewski

In conclusion, Gukesh's unique approach to chess, as articulated by his coach, highlights not only his talent but also his aspiration to achieve greatness while staying true to his own style.

item.title: 'I felt like I was using a toothpick': Michael Hussey recalls facing a young Jasprit Bumrah - The Times of India
item.description:
Michael Hussey Reflects on Facing Young Jasprit Bumrah

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Former Australian cricketer Michael Hussey shares his memories of facing a young Jasprit Bumrah during the 2014 IPL, providing insight into Bumrah’s unconventional style and remarkable career journey.

  • Hussey recalled feeling like he was using a toothpick when facing Bumrah, emphasizing the bowler's deceptive action and fierce speed.
  • Initially, Bumrah was seen as a white-ball specialist, with doubts about his ability in Test cricket due to his unique bowling technique.
  • Hussey expressed admiration for Bumrah’s evolution into one of the world’s best bowlers.
  • He recounted a pivotal moment when Bumrah dismissed AB de Villiers in 2014 and provided advice on maintaining humility and respect in the game.
“I felt like I was using a toothpick.” - Michael Hussey on facing Jasprit Bumrah
“Isn't he doing it bloody well at the moment? It's just phenomenal to see how he's grown.” - Michael Hussey

Hussey’s reflections highlight Bumrah’s impressive journey from a young bowler in the nets to a world-class player, emphasizing the importance of skill and character in cricket.

item.title: Australian Media Lashes Out At Ravindra Jadeja For Avoiding English Questions, India Burst Fake Narrative - Times Now
item.description:
Australian Media Targets Indian Team Again: Controversy Over Ravindra Jadeja’s Press Conference

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times Now

The Indian cricket team is embroiled in another controversy following Australian media's biased reporting against them stemming from Ravindra Jadeja's press conference intended for Indian journalists.

  • The incident was preceded by a confrontation between Virat Kohli and an Australian reporter at the airport, intensifying media tensions.
  • The press conference was hijacked by Cricket Australia’s media team, allowing Australian journalists to participate without prior coordination.
  • No Australian journalists were able to ask questions because the time was taken up by Hindi questions from Indian reporters.
  • The subsequent reaction from Australian media was misleading, linking the press conference to Kohli's earlier incident and publishing biased stories.
  • Indian officials confirmed that there were no language restrictions imposed during the press conference.
“Our media manager never imposed a language restriction. Ravindra Jadeja is proficient in English and would have answered any questions posed to him.”

This incident underscores the ongoing narrative of biased reporting by the Australian media targeting the Indian cricket team, particularly during important matches of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

item.title: Ravindra Jadeja Slammed For Speaking Hindi In Australia By Media Outlet. Report Termed As 'Hypocrisy.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Ravindra Jadeja Faces Backlash for Speaking Hindi in Australia, Media Calls It 'Hypocrisy'

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: NDTV

The India vs Australia Test series has been marred by controversy as Ravindra Jadeja faced criticism for conducting a press conference in Hindi. This has sparked debate among media outlets regarding language and communication barriers in international sports contexts.

  • Ravindra Jadeja held a press conference before the Boxing Day Test, where he answered questions in Hindi.
  • Australian media expressed their frustration, labeling the situation as 'annoying' since they were unable to engage with Jadeja in English.
  • Indian journalists defended Jadeja, suggesting that the Australian media was overreacting to the situation.
  • This incident follows another controversy involving Virat Kohli and media interactions at the airport.
“Several social media users termed the report as 'hypocrisy'.”

In conclusion, the incident reflects ongoing tensions between media expectations and individual language preferences in international sports events.

item.title: 'Build stadium at border': Pakistan batter Shehzad suggests bizarre idea for IND-PAK matches, unhappy with ICC’s plan - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Build stadium at border: Pakistan batter Shehzad suggests bizarre idea for IND-PAK matches, unhappy with ICC’s plan

Date: Dec 21, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Pakistan cricketer Ahmed Shehzad expressed disappointment with the ICC's new hybrid model for India-Pakistan cricket matches, suggesting a controversial idea for a stadium located at the India-Pakistan border.

  • The ICC approved a hybrid model for the upcoming Champions Trophy due to diplomatic tensions.
  • Shehzad believes this decision locks Pakistan out of future chances to host India for ICC events.
  • He proposed building a stadium at the border, with separate entrances for players from both nations.
  • Despite this idea, Shehzad noted practical issues like visa regulations preventing Indian players from crossing over.
  • Pakistan is the defending Champions Trophy winner, having last faced India in the 2024 T20 World Cup.
“Pakistan had a golden chance to host India. ICC cannot back off. PCB has missed the chance I think.” – Ahmed Shehzad

Shehzad's suggestion highlights the ongoing challenges facing cricketing relations between India and Pakistan, reflecting a deep desire for competitive matches amidst political realities.

item.title: Robin Uthappa, former India cricketer, faces arrest over provident fund ‘fraud’: Reports - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Robin Uthappa Faces Arrest Over Provident Fund Fraud Allegations

Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

An arrest warrant has been issued against former Indian cricketer Robin Uthappa in connection with an alleged EPFO fraud case where he failed to deposit provident fund contributions deducted from employees' salaries.

  • An arrest warrant was issued by PF regional commissioner Shadakshari Gopal Reddy.
  • Uthappa is accused of not depositing ₹23 lakh in provident fund contributions while managing Century Lifestyle Brand Private Limited.
  • The warrant mandates the police to arrest Uthappa and return by December 27.
  • Uthappa and his family reportedly reside in Dubai.
  • He has represented India in 59 international matches and was a prominent player in the IPL.
“The warrant which was executed on December 4 has been returned after Mr. Uthappa was found not to be at the Pulakeshinagar residence,” officials said.

This situation highlights serious allegations against Uthappa, affecting his reputation and potentially leading to legal consequences.

item.title: Arrest warrant against cricketer Robin Uthappa for failing to deposit employees’ PF into their accounts - The Hindu
item.description:
Arrest Warrant Issued for Cricketer Robin Uthappa Over PF Cheating Case

Published: December 21, 2024 11:48 am IST | Source: The Hindu

An arrest warrant has been issued against former India cricketer Robin Uthappa in an alleged Provident Fund (PF) cheating case. The warrant was issued by PF Regional Commissioner Shadakshari Gopal Reddy, who has asked the jurisdictional Pulakeshinagar police to take necessary action.

  • The warrant was executed on December 4 but Uthappa was not found at his residence.
  • Uthappa is accused of deducting PF contributions from employee salaries but failing to deposit those funds into their accounts.
  • He currently resides in Dubai with his family.
“The warrant which was executed on December 4 has been returned after Mr. Uthappa was found not to be at the Pulakeshinagar residence,” officials said.

This incident highlights the serious implications of financial misconduct involving employee welfare funds.

item.title: Arrest warrant against cricketer Robin Uthappa for not paying PF to his employees - The Hindu
item.description:
Arrest Warrant Issued for Cricketer Robin Uthappa Over PF Cheating Case

Published: December 21, 2024 11:48 am IST | Source: The Hindu

An arrest warrant has been issued against former India cricketer Robin Uthappa in an alleged Provident Fund (PF) cheating case. The warrant was issued by PF Regional Commissioner Shadakshari Gopal Reddy, who has asked the jurisdictional Pulakeshinagar police to take necessary action.

  • The warrant was executed on December 4 but Uthappa was not found at his residence.
  • Uthappa is accused of deducting PF contributions from employee salaries but failing to deposit those funds into their accounts.
  • He currently resides in Dubai with his family.
“The warrant which was executed on December 4 has been returned after Mr. Uthappa was found not to be at the Pulakeshinagar residence,” officials said.

This incident highlights the serious implications of financial misconduct involving employee welfare funds.

item.title: EPF fraud: Arrest warrant issued against ex-cricketer Robin Uthappa - The Times of India
item.description:
Arrest Warrant Issued Against Former Cricketer Robin Uthappa in EPF Fraud Case

Publication Date: October 20, 2023, Source: Times of India

In a significant development, an arrest warrant has been issued against former Indian cricketer Robin Uthappa in connection with a fraudulent withdrawal of Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) funds.

  • The warrant was issued by a local court following a request from EPF officials.
  • Uthappa allegedly conspired with others to siphon off EPF money.
  • The case has raised concerns about fraud within the EPF system.
"This case highlights the vulnerability of the EPF system to fraud and the need for better safeguards." - EPF Official

The incident underlines the growing issue of financial fraud affecting players and supports the need for enhanced regulations.

item.title: 'Grateful to walk through life ... ': Rohit Sharma pens emotional note on wife Ritika Sajdeh's birthday - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma's Heartfelt Birthday Tribute to Wife Ritika Sajdeh

Publication Date: October 20, 2023
Source: Times of India

Indian cricketer Rohit Sharma shared an emotional note celebrating his wife Ritika Sajdeh's birthday, expressing his gratitude for their life together.

  • Rohit expressed his deep appreciation for Ritika's support and companionship.
  • The note mentioned specific memories and moments that have strengthened their bond.
  • Rohit celebrated not just her birthday but the love and partnership they share.
"Grateful to walk through life with you by my side."

This heartfelt message highlights the importance of personal connections and love in one's life.

item.title: "Spent Whole Day Together...": Ravichandran Ashwin's '5 Minutes Before PC' Retirement Shocker To 'Pa.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Ravichandran Ashwin's Retirement Shocks Teammate Ravindra Jadeja

Date: September 22, 2024 | Source: NDTV Sports

Ravindra Jadeja expressed his surprise at learning about Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement just five minutes before it was announced at a press conference. The pair, known for their formidable partnership on the cricket field, reflected on their shared experiences and contributions.

  • Ashwin revealed his retirement after the third Test against Australia.
  • Jadeja highlighted their long-standing partnership and mentorship on the field.
  • The duo's collaboration was critical in India's Test victories.
  • Jadeja is hopeful for Ashwin's replacement in the team.
  • Ashwin's career statistics include 537 wickets and 3,503 runs in 106 Tests.
“I got to know about it at the last moment, almost five minutes before the press conference.” - Ravindra Jadeja

The Indian cricket team now faces the challenge of filling Ashwin's significant role in the squad.

item.title: "Spent Whole Day Together...": Ravichandran Ashwin's '5 Minutes Before PC' Retirement Shocker To 'Partner In Crime' - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Ravichandran Ashwin's Retirement Shocks Teammate Ravindra Jadeja

Date: September 22, 2024 | Source: NDTV Sports

Ravindra Jadeja expressed his surprise at learning about Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement just five minutes before it was announced at a press conference. The pair, known for their formidable partnership on the cricket field, reflected on their shared experiences and contributions.

  • Ashwin revealed his retirement after the third Test against Australia.

  • The duo's collaboration was critical in India's Test victories.

The Indian cricket team now faces the challenge of filling Ashwin's significant role in the squad.

item.title: Sutherland's 78-ball century overwhelms NZ in rain-hit ODI - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Sutherland's 78-Ball Century Leads Australia to Victory Over New Zealand

Date: October 2023
Source: ESPN Cricinfo

In a rain-affected ODI match, Annabel Sutherland scored a remarkable 105 not out, helping Australia to defeat New Zealand by 65 runs via the DLS method.

Key Points:

  • Australia set a target of 291 for 7.
  • Sutherland's knock was pivotal as she completed her century off just 78 balls.
  • New Zealand struggled in their run chase, finishing at 122 for 5.
  • The match was interrupted by rain, but Australia had already secured the win by the required runs.
  • Captain Alyssa Healy returned from injury, scoring 34 runs.
“Sutherland fittingly finished the innings with a boundary as her stunning rise in international cricket continued.”

This victory marks Australia's 14th consecutive ODI win, reaffirming their dominance in women's cricket.

item.title: 'Surrender slightly to the game': Ex-India batting coach's advice to 'out-of-form' Virat Kohli - The Times of India
item.description:
‘Surrender slightly to the game’: Ex-India batting coach's advice to 'out-of-form' Virat Kohli

Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The former batting coach of the Indian cricket team has offered valuable advice to Virat Kohli as he navigates a challenging phase in his career, suggesting he should adapt his game approach.

  • The coach emphasizes the importance of flexibility in batting style.
  • He believes that a slight surrender to the game will help Kohli regain form.
  • The dialogue highlights the pressures faced by top athletes in competitive sports.
“To succeed, sometimes you need to surrender to the game's demands,” the coach noted.

In conclusion, adapting to changing circumstances and being open to new strategies can lead to improved performance for players like Kohli.

item.title: ‘He will never be like Magnus Carlsen’: D Gukesh’s chief trainer makes staggering comparison, claims ‘doesn’t like to…’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
D Gukesh's Trainer Compares Young Chess Champion to Magnus Carlsen

Publication Date: Dec 21, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

D Gukesh has made history by becoming the youngest-ever world chess champion, defeating Ding Liren to claim the title. His trainer, Grzegorz Gajewski, likened him to Magnus Carlsen, while asserting that Gukesh will never play like the Norwegian.

  • D Gukesh, at 18, becomes the youngest world chess champion.
  • His victory against Ding Liren marks a significant achievement for Indian chess.
  • Trainer Grzegorz Gajewski believes Gukesh can mimic Carlsen's style but not embody it.
  • Gukesh prefers calculation and depth over intuition in his gameplay.
  • Former champion Magnus Carlsen had a mixed response to Gukesh's win.
“He will never be a player like Magnus Carlsen in the sense of being an intuitive kind of a player,” said Grzegorz Gajewski.

In conclusion, while Gukesh's training and achievements position him as a rising star in chess, the comparison to Carlsen is complex and reflects differing playing styles.

item.title: 'Maybe indication that he is no longer in the scheme of things': EAS Prasanna on R Ashwin's sudden retire - The Times of India
item.description:
Maybe indication that he is no longer in the scheme of things: EAS Prasanna on R Ashwin's sudden retirement

Date: [Date of Publication] Source: [Source of Publication]

In a recent statement, cricket legend EAS Prasanna expressed concern regarding R Ashwin's unexpected retirement from the game, suggesting it may indicate a shift in his standing within the team.

  • Prasanna outlines the implications of Ashwin's retirement.
  • Discusses Ashwin's contributions to Indian cricket over the years.
  • Speculates on the reasons behind Ashwin's decision.
“Maybe this is an indication that he is no longer in the scheme of things,” said EAS Prasanna.

Prasanna's comments raise questions about the future direction of the Indian cricket team as they navigate post-retirement adjustments.

item.title: IND vs AUS: Ravindra Jadeja pays tribute to 'on-field mentor' R Ashwin - The Times of India
item.description:
IND vs AUS: Ravindra Jadeja pays tribute to 'on-field mentor' R Ashwin

Publication Date: New Delhi

Source: Times of India

Ravindra Jadeja expressed that he will deeply miss Ravichandran Ashwin, whom he considers an on-field mentor, after Ashwin announced his retirement during the Test series against Australia.

  • Ashwin retires as India’s second-highest wicket-taker in Tests with 537 wickets.
  • He and Jadeja took 587 wickets together in 58 Tests, surpassing the Kumble-Harbhajan duo.
  • Jadeja praised Ashwin's mentorship and their communication during matches.
  • They will reunite in IPL 2025 for Chennai Super Kings.
  • Ashwin reflected on his career and significant memories with teammates.
“This will be my last day as an Indian cricketer in all formats at the international level. I do feel there's a bit of punch left in me as a cricketer, but I would like to expose... I've had a lot of fun.” - R Ashwin

Jadeja's sentiments highlight the bond formed between the two over many years, while Ashwin's retirement marks a significant moment in Indian cricket history.

item.title: Harbhajan Singh breaks silence on rumoured rift with Ravichandran Ashwin - The Times of India
item.description:
Harbhajan Singh Addresses Rumors of Rift with Ravichandran Ashwin

Publication Date: Date Not Specified Source: Times of India

Indian cricketer Harbhajan Singh has spoken out against rumors of a rift with fellow spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, particularly after Ashwin's recent retirement announcement.

  • Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from international cricket.
  • Ashwin is India's second-highest wicket-taker across all formats.
  • Speculation about a rift between Ashwin and Harbhajan has circulated over the years.
  • Harbhajan dispelled rumors, stating there is no discord between them.
"I would be the first person to go up to him and ask what the issue is. But it was never like this, and it will never be like this." - Harbhajan Singh

Harbhajan acknowledges the achievements of Ashwin and emphasizes respect among teammates, noting that social media sometimes misrepresents sentiments.
